### Problem

Running `sudo make install` after building neovim in a clone of the repository that does *NOT* contain a `.git` directory causes future invocations of `make` to fail, as some build files are now owned by root:

```
mkdir -p ".deps"
/usr/bin/cmake -S /home/nasso/neovim//cmake.deps -B ".deps" -G "Ninja"
-- Found GNU Make at /usr/bin/gmake
-- CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release
-- Configuring done
-- Generating done
-- Build files have been written to: /home/nasso/neovim/.deps
mkdir -p build
touch "build/.ran-deps-cmake"
/usr/bin/cmake --build ".deps"
ninja: no work to do.
/usr/bin/cmake --build build
[0/2] Re-checking globbed directories...
[1/137] cd /home/nasso/neovim/build/src/nvim && /usr/bin/cmake -D NVIM_VERSION_MAJOR=0 -D NVIM_VERSION_M...versiondef_git.h -D NVIM_SOURCE_DIR=/home/nasso/neovim -P /home/nasso/neovim/cmake/GenerateVersion.cmake
-- Using NVIM_VERSION: v0.10.5-dev
[3/137] Generating auto/version.c.generated.h, ../../include/version.h.generated.h
FAILED: src/nvim/auto/version.c.generated.h include/version.h.generated.h /home/nasso/neovim/build/src/nvim/auto/version.c.generated.h /home/nasso/neovim/build/include/version.h.generated.h
cd /home/nasso/neovim/build/src/nvim && /usr/bin/cc /home/nasso/neovim/src/nvim/version.c -E -o /home/nasso/neovim/build/src/nvim/auto/version.i -DHAVE_UNIBILIUM -D_GNU_SOURCE -I/home/nasso/neovim/.deps/usr/include/luajit-2.1 -I/home/nasso/neovim/.deps/usr/include -I/home/nasso/neovim/build/src/nvim/auto -I/home/nasso/neovim/build/include -I/home/nasso/neovim/build/cmake.config -I/home/nasso/neovim/src -I/usr/include && /home/nasso/neovim/.deps/usr/bin/luajit /home/nasso/neovim/src/nvim/generators/preload.lua /home/nasso/neovim /home/nasso/neovim/build/lib/libnlua0.so /home/nasso/neovim/build /home/nasso/neovim/src/nvim/generators/gen_declarations.lua /home/nasso/neovim/src/nvim/version.c /home/nasso/neovim/build/src/nvim/auto/version.c.generated.h /home/nasso/neovim/build/include/version.h.generated.h /home/nasso/neovim/build/src/nvim/auto/version.i
error: unable to open output file '/home/nasso/neovim/build/src/nvim/auto/version.i': 'Operation not permitted'
1 error generated.
[4/137] Generating auto/api/private/dispatch_wrappers.generated.h, auto/api/private/api_metadata.generated.h, ../../funcs_metadata.mpack, auto/lua_api_c_bindings.generated.h, auto/keysets_defs.generated.h
ninja: build stopped: subcommand failed.
make: *** [Makefile:84: nvim] Error 1
```

### Steps to reproduce

```sh
git clone https://github.com/neovim/neovim.git
cd neovim
rm -rf .git

make CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RelWithDebInfo
sudo make install

# fails!
make CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RelWithDebInfo
```

### Expected behavior

- running `make` after `sudo make install` doesn't fail, whether a `.git` directory is present or not

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

0.10.5-dev (28a8d59c)

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

N/A

### Operating system/version

Debian GNU/Linux 12 (bookworm)

### Terminal name/version

Kitty 0.35.1

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-256color

### Installation

build from repo cloned in a way that doesn't result in a `.git` directory being present (I happen to use [jj](https://jj-vcs.github.io/jj/) **without** [`--colocate`](https://jj-vcs.github.io/jj/latest/git-compatibility/#co-located-jujutsugit-repos))

comment_data.body:
Just realised something very interesting: I happen to use [jj](https://jj-vcs.github.io/jj/) instead of git, and I cloned neovim with `jj git clone $URL`. That means the repository does NOT contain a `.git` directory.

I tried again with `jj git clone $URL --colocate`, which basically just means there will be a `.git` directory as if it was just cloned with `git clone $URL`. Bingo, works as expected (some files are still owned by root, but they don't prevent `make` to run again).

I'm assuming the build system is somehow relying on `.git` to know when and what to build again??? That's a bit unfortunate, there are many other ways to fetch the source (e.g. tarballs) that won't result in a `.git` directory being present.

I will edit the post and title to reflect this.

> That's a bit unfortunate, there are many other ways to fetch the source (e.g. tarballs) that won't result in a .git directory being present.

Yes, but we don't (need to) optimize _rebuilding_ for those; these situations are most likely to be one-off builds in CI or a packaging step.

title: `sudo make install` breaks subsequent `make` invocations when no `.git` directory is present
